title: Onboarding
pageTitle: Make a claim to an employment tribunal
serviceInfo: Use this service to make claims to an employment tribunal when an employer, potential employer, trade union or person at work has treated another person unlawfully.
infoTxt: During the employment tribunal process the organisations or people you're making a claim against are known as ‘respondents’.
warningTxt1:
To make a claim you need to contact Acas and get an ‘Early conciliation certificate’ from them or give us a valid reason why you do not have one.

If you do not have a certificate or a reason you need to contact Acas.
saveInfo: You do not have to make your claim in one go. You can save and return to it at any time before you submit it.
warningTxt2: Claims usually have to be made within 3 months of employment ending or problems happening. If a claim is late, you must explain why. A judge will then decide what happens next.
claimStartedTxt: Have you already started a claim?
contactUsHelpTxt: Call one of our Employment Tribunal customer contact centres. They cannot give you legal advice.
